summary: 5/27/1993: Richard Thomas Andrews set a fire at the Women's Health Care clinic in Boise, Idaho, United States. There were no casualties, but the building sustained $100,000 in damages.
motive: To protest the practice of abortion and to sabotage abortion facilities operating in Idaho.
propcomment: Front door and surrounding area burned.  Extensive smoke damage throughout building.
addnotes: The fire was ignited around 3:00 AM.
scite1: "Arson Fire Damages Abortion Clinic," Moscow-Pullman Daily News, May 27, 1993.
scite2: Kelly McBride, "Fed Say Protests Escalated to Arson Man Suspected in 8 Fires at Abortion Clinics," The Spokesman Review, October 24, 1997.
scite3: "Attacks on the West Coast," The Oregonian, January 31, 1994.
